races.Versatile: Humans gain +1 to all ability scores, making them adaptable to any class.
races.Extra Language: You can speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice.
races.Extra Skill Proficiency: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
races.Darkvision: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.
races.Keen Senses: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
races.Fey Ancestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.
races.Trance: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply for 4 hours a day.
races.Elf Weapon Training: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.
races.Dwarven Resilience: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.
races.Dwarven Combat Training: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.
races.Stonecunning: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient and add double your proficiency bonus.
races.Lucky: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
races.Brave: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
races.Halfling Nimbleness: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.
races.Draconic Ancestry: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type.
races.Breath Weapon: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.
races.Damage Resistance: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
races.Hellish Resistance: You have resistance to fire damage.
races.Infernal Legacy: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell once per day as a 2nd-level spell. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the darkness spell once per day.
races.Gnome Cunning: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
races.Menacing: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
races.Relentless Endurance: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
races.Savage Attacks: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
races.Skill Versatility: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

classes.Fighting Style: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one fighting style option.
classes.Second Wind: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.
classes.Action Surge: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.
classes.Extra Attack: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
classes.Spellcasting: You have learned to cast spells through study, devotion, or innate power. You can cast spells using spell slots.
classes.Arcane Recovery: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day during a short rest, you can recover spell slots.
classes.Spellbook: At 1st level, you have a spellbook containing six 1st-level wizard spells of your choice.
classes.Ritual Casting: You can cast a wizard spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook.
classes.Divine Domain: Choose one domain related to your deity. Your domain grants you domain spells and other features.
classes.Channel Divinity: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using it to fuel magical effects.
classes.Turn Undead: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or be turned.
classes.Expertise: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
classes.Sneak Attack: Once per turn, you can deal extra damage (1d6, increasing with level) to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage or an ally is within 5 feet of the target.
classes.Thieves' Cant: During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.
classes.Cunning Action: Starting at 2nd level, you can take a bonus action on each of your turns to Dash, Disengage, or Hide.
classes.Favored Enemy: You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. You have advantage on Survival checks to track them.
classes.Natural Explorer: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.
classes.Ranger Archetype: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate, such as Hunter or Beast Master.
classes.Rage: In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action, gaining bonus damage, resistance to physical damage, and advantage on Strength checks.
classes.Unarmored Defense: While not wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier (Barbarian) or Wisdom modifier (Monk).
classes.Bardic Inspiration: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die can roll it and add the number to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.
classes.Druidic: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can use it to leave hidden messages that only other druids can understand.
classes.Wild Shape: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before.
classes.Martial Arts: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You can use Dexterity for attack and damage rolls, and roll a d4 for unarmed damage.
classes.Divine Sense: As an action, you can detect the presence of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60 feet of you. You know the type but not identity.
classes.Lay on Hands: You have a pool of healing power equal to your paladin level Ã— 5. As an action, you can touch a creature and restore hit points from this pool.
classes.Sorcerous Origin: Choose a sorcerous origin that describes the source of your innate magical power, such as Draconic Bloodline or Wild Magic.
classes.Pact Magic: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. Your spell slots recover on a short rest.
classes.Eldritch Invocations: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability.
